clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Relationship Between Blood Groups,RH and Skeletal Malocclusion : a Cross Sectional Study
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Relationship Between Blood Groups,RH and Skeletal Malocclusion in a Group of Egyptian Population: a Cross Sectional Study

brief_summary.textblock: the study is searching if there is a relationship between the blood groups and RH and the skeletal malocclusion using the skeletal class I as a control group

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be conducted on the patients seeking medical care in the orthodontic department Cairo University, for six months all patients with class II and class III malocclusion will be recruited based on Wits appraisal measured from the cephalometric X-ray taken routinely during orthodontic examination. Then a group of class I arch length discrepancy patients will be used as control. A blood sample will be withdrawn and taken to the Cairo university laboratory to analyze the blood group and RH .a statistical analysis will be performed to detect a relationship between skeletal malocclusion and the blood groups as compared to the control

primary_outcome.measure: relationship between blood group and skeletal malocclusion
primary_outcome.time_frame: the recruitment will be for six months
primary_outcome.description: If skeletal malocclusion subjects were found to have a high percentage of a certain blood type or RH when compared to the control group it will be reported that there is a relationship between blood group and skeletal malocclusion. If percentages of blood groups are approximately the same in the malocclusion subjects and the control then the investigator will report that there is no relationship between blood groups and skeletal malocclusion

arm_group.description: patients with wits appraisal more than 3 mm measured on a cephalometric x ray obtained during diagnosis
patients with wits appraisal less than -3 mm measured on a cephalometric x ray obtained during diagnosis

patients with Wits appraisal between -3 and +3 that is measured from a cephalometric x ray obtained during diagnosis of arch length discrepancy. this group will serve as control and obtained after recruitment of the other 2 groups in 1 to 1 fashion

intervention.description: a blood sample will be withdrawn from the subjects tested by anti A anti B and anti D antigens to detect the individuals blood group and RH. then statistical analysis to detect presence of a relationship between skeletal types of malocclusion and ABO blood groups

study_pop.textblock: all patients with skeletal malovclusion seeking medical care in the orthodontic department of cairo university for six months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
skeletal class I,II and III patients non syndromic patients above the age of 18 no previous surgical intervention for correction of skeletal malocclusion
Exclusion Criteria:
- syndromic patients
- cleft patients
- patients with previous surgery to correct skeletal malocclusion
